subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The Washington Redskins hired Jim Zorn as their coach Saturday night, a surprise ending to a monthlong search for a replacement for Joe Gibbs.“I’ve always dreamed of being a head coach with a franchise rich in tradition like the Redskins,” Zorn said in a team news release. “As a player who had to fight Redskins teams at R.F.K. as well as at our home field, I know about the history of this franchise as well as the passion of its fans. I won’t let you down.”The Redskins said Zorn, 54, agreed to a five-year contract.Zorn, a former Seattle quarterback, has been the Seahawks’ quarterbacks coach for the last seven years. The Redskins hired him to be their offensive coordinator Jan. 26 while continuing their search for a head coach. Zorn replaces Gibbs, who resigned Jan. 8.
